page.title: 02A GRAYS SCHOOL, 1985
page.content: { In 1985 we have childrens tables in groups,no teachers desks,brightly decorated walls,and very little use of a blackboard if any.A computer bleeps away in one quiet corner with a group of children absorbed with its monitor. Other groups of children are working with calculators,or writing their stories with roller ball pens. A carpet lies in one corner of the room with a few children sitting relaxed on cushions enjoying colourful books,while a few more paint in another corner,using bright glorious colours. Most classes have pets of some kind, gerbils, rabbits or guinea pigs for example, and the children take care of them. The atmosphere is relaxed and friendly.
